reviews.review: This movie was incredibly stunning in terms of visuals, character design, and plot. I grew up with the Toy Story movies and even as an adult it hasn't lost its charm or magic. This was a really risky reboot for Pixar to make since it could've disappointed the fans if not done right but man am I glad they nailed it!
I loved this movie I think it was great a must see

What I thought was gonna be a Shameless Sequel Cash-grab, actually turned out to be a heartwarming story, with awesome animation, and our favorite characters back and much more, even with an unexpected ending.

The first half of this movie was great. Well animated, funny, cute. I know my child enjoys the idea of toys having a reality that adults are just to myopic to see but that kids fully enjoy. I thought the movie took a turn for the worse (from 5 stars down to 4) when the story became too much about the toys, and less of the cute interaction between the toys and the humans. Then, it became downright creepy when (spoiler alert) the doll Gabby went psycho on Woody, having her mannequin "goons" on woody to basically harvest his organs (voice box) for her own selfish enterprise. Really, I don't know if other adults picked up on this even though I'm sure the kids didn't. I honestly could not decide if Gabby was supposed to be a villain in this plot, yet the story was told as though she were a sympathetic character. Maybe I'm overthinking this. I think for the kiddos, still a great flick. For the adults, maybe a good opportunity for a restroom break halfway through.
The whole Gabby Gabby plot line was morbid.  And her hit men scared my 5-year old great nephew.

We cried and laughed the entire last 20 minutes. Whether you've always been a Toy Story fan or just getting started,t he storyline in Toy Story 4 will capture your heart and imagination as you follow Woody, Bo, Buzz and the team on a new adventure.
This was a great conclusion to the Toy Story series!
loved must see.  hope they make a 5
Very funny and out we loved it!
Better than Toy Story 3. The humor was there, but I knew how it would end in the first 10 minutes.
